00047 #define BPy_BMesh_Check(v)      (Py_TYPE(v) == &BPy_BMesh_Type)
00048 #define BPy_BMVert_Check(v)     (Py_TYPE(v) == &BPy_BMVert_Type)
00049 #define BPy_BMEdge_Check(v)     (Py_TYPE(v) == &BPy_BMEdge_Type)

00059 /* cast from _any_ bmesh type - they all have BMesh first */
00060 typedef struct BPy_BMGeneric {
00061     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00062     struct BMesh *bm; /* keep first */
00063 } BPy_BMGeneric;
00064 
00065 /* BPy_BMVert/BPy_BMEdge/BPy_BMFace/BPy_BMLoop can cast to this */
00066 typedef struct BPy_BMElem {
00067     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00068     struct BMesh *bm; /* keep first */
00069     struct BMElem *ele;
00070 } BPy_BMElem;
00071 
00072 typedef struct BPy_BMesh {
00073     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00074     struct BMesh *bm; /* keep first */
00075     int flag;
00076 } BPy_BMesh;
00077 
00078 /* element types */
00079 typedef struct BPy_BMVert {
00080     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00081     struct BMesh *bm; /* keep first */
00082     struct BMVert *v;
00083 } BPy_BMVert;
00084 
00085 typedef struct BPy_BMEdge {
00086     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00087     struct BMesh *bm; /* keep first */
00088     struct BMEdge *e;
00089 } BPy_BMEdge;
00090 
00091 typedef struct BPy_BMFace {
00092     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00093     struct BMesh *bm; /* keep first */
00094     struct BMFace *f;
00095 } BPy_BMFace;
00096 
00097 typedef struct BPy_BMLoop {
00098     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00099     struct BMesh *bm; /* keep first */
00100     struct BMLoop *l;
00101 } BPy_BMLoop;
00102 
00103 
00104 /* iterators */
00105 
00106 /* used for ...
00107  * - BPy_BMElemSeq_Type
00108  * - BPy_BMVertSeq_Type
00109  * - BPy_BMEdgeSeq_Type
00110  * - BPy_BMFaceSeq_Type
00111  * - BPy_BMLoopSeq_Type
00112  */
00113 typedef struct BPy_BMElemSeq {
00114     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00115     struct BMesh *bm; /* keep first */
00116 
00117     /* if this is a sequence on an existing element,
00118      * loops of faces for eg.
00119      * If this veriable is set, it will be used */
00120 
00121     /* we hold a reference to this.
00122      * check in case the owner becomes invalid on access */
00123     /* TODO - make this a GC'd object!, will function OK without this though */
00124     BPy_BMElem *py_ele;
00125 
00126     /* iterator type */
00127     short itype;
00128 } BPy_BMElemSeq;
00129 
00130 typedef struct BPy_BMIter {
00131     PyObject_VAR_HEAD
00132     struct BMesh *bm; /* keep first */
00133     BMIter iter;
00134 } BPy_BMIter;

00140 enum {
00141     BPY_BMFLAG_NOP = 0,       /* do nothing */
00142     BPY_BMFLAG_IS_WRAPPED = 1 /* the mesh is owned by editmode */
00143 };

00173 #define BPY_BM_CHECK_OBJ(obj) if (UNLIKELY(bpy_bm_generic_valid_check((BPy_BMGeneric *)obj) == -1)) { return NULL; } (void)0
00174 #define BPY_BM_CHECK_INT(obj) if (UNLIKELY(bpy_bm_generic_valid_check((BPy_BMGeneric *)obj) == -1)) { return -1; }   (void)0
00175 
00176 #define BPY_BM_IS_VALID(obj) (LIKELY((obj)->bm != NULL))
00177 
00178 #define BM_ITER_BPY_BM_SEQ(ele, iter, bpy_bmelemseq)                          \
00179     for (ele = BM_iter_new(iter,                                              \
00180                            (bpy_bmelemseq)->bm,                               \
00181                            (bpy_bmelemseq)->itype,                            \
00182                            (bpy_bmelemseq)->py_ele ?                          \
00183                                ((BPy_BMElem *)(bpy_bmelemseq)->py_ele)->ele : \
00184                                NULL                                           \
00185                            );                                                 \
00186          ele;                                                                 \
00187          ele = BM_iter_step(iter))
